question.text: Japanese restaurants in Sapporo and Japanese restaurants in Hakodate are to be searched for together. Which of the following is the logical expression that represents the search condition?

options.text: ("Sapporo" AND "Hakodate") AND "Japanese restaurant"
("Sapporo" AND "Hakodate") OR "Japanese restaurant"
("Sapporo" OR "Hakodate") AND "Japanese restaurant"
("Sapporo" OR "Hakodate") OR "Japanese restaurant"

question.text: Which of the following is always true for two (2) sets A and B? Here, (X ∩ Y) represents the intersection and (X ∪ Y) represents the union of sets X and Y.
question.images: Implied set theory figure/notation referenced in source

options.text: (Missing option A)
(Missing option B)
(A ∩ B) ⊆ A
(Missing option D)

question.text: Which of the following is the binary number that is obtained by adding the binary numbers 01011010 and 01101011? Here, the binary numbers are expressed as positive 8-bit values.

When a chairperson and a secretary are selected from three (3) candidates with a method that allows dual roles, there are three (3) ways for the selection of a single chairperson and three (3) ways for the selection of a secretary, so in total, there are nine (9) combinations for the selection of a chairperson and a secretary. When a chairperson and a secretary are selected from five (5) candidates with a method that allows dual roles, how many combinations for the selection are there?

In a queue, three (3) elements 33, 27, and 12 are enqueued in this order. After the element 45 is enqueued to this queue, two (2) elements are retrieved (or dequeued). Which of the following is the second element to be retrieved?
Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning HTML?

options.text: It is a markup language that can specify the logical structure and layout of a web page by using tags.
It is a script language that can describe the program or processing steps executed on a web browser.
It is a communication protocol that is used between a web browser and a web server.
It is a markup language that enables users to describe the meaning and structure of data by defining their own unique tags.

question.text: Which of the following represents a processing procedure of a program graphically?

options.text: Gantt chart
Data flow diagram
Flowchart
Radar chart

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning machine language?

options.text: A program that is written in Fortran or C is converted into machine language and then executed.
Machine language is a high-level language.
Machine language expresses a program with sequences of decimal numbers.
Most of application software is still programmed in machine language.

question.text: As shown in Figure 1, there is a box that generates two (2) numerical values B1 and B2 when two (2) positive integers A1 and A2 are entered. B1 has the same value as A2, and B2 is the remainder of A1 divided by A2. As shown in Figure 2, when two (2) boxes are connected, and 49 is entered as A1 and 11 is entered as A2 in the left box, what is the value of B2 generated from the right box?
Which of the following is an appropriate description of a dual-core processor?

options.text: Two (2) types of OS are installed on a single PC, and the PC is configured so that either OS can be booted.
Two (2) displays are connected to a single PC in order to have a single continuous wide display area across the two (2) displays.
Two (2) strips of memory with the same standard and capacity are combined, and the effective speed of data transfer is increased by accessing each strip concurrently.
The integrated circuits of two (2) processors are implemented on a single LSI chip, and they process data in parallel or concurrently.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning the primary cache memory and the secondary cache memory of a CPU?

options.text: The primary cache memory has larger capacity than the secondary cache memory.
The secondary cache memory is slower than the main memory in writing and reading.
When the CPU reads data, it first accesses the primary cache memory, and then it accesses the secondary cache memory if the data is not available.
All of the data that is required for a process needs to be present on the primary or secondary cache memory when a program starts.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning a device driver that enables the use of peripheral devices with a PC?

options.text: When a hard disk drive is initialized and the operating system is reinstalled, it is necessary to reinstall device drivers that were installed separately to the operating system.
When new application software is installed, it is necessary to reinstall all device drivers that this software uses.
Even if a device driver is no longer required, a user cannot delete the device driver once it is installed.
It is only necessary to install one (1) device driver for a printer to use all printers regardless of manufacturer or model.

question.text: Which of the following is a chip that is used in image processing in devices such as PCs and smartphones, and is also used for large amount of calculation processing in AI?

options.text: AR
DVI
GPU
MPEG

question.text: The system configurations A through C are made up by connecting multiple identical devices. Which of the following is a list where A through C are sorted in descending order of availability? Here, the figure implies parallel and series connections. The parallel connection requires only one (1) of the devices to be functional, while the series connection requires all devices to be functional.
question.images: Implied figure showing device configurations A, B, C

options.text: A, B, C
B, A, C
C, A, B
C, B, A

question.text: Which of the following includes all the appropriate measures to enable the normal execution of processing even in the event of a failure in part of a system? (1) Configuring HDDs with mirroring (2) Minimizing the frequency of maintenance and inspections after stable operation of the system starts (3) Grouping multiple redundant network lines into a single high-speed line (4) Making power supply redundant with the use of UPS (Uninterrupted Power Supply) etc.

Among the methods I through III for handling multiple hard disks as one (1) logical disk, which of the following lists all and only the methods that can recover data even if one of the constituent hard disks fails? I RAID5 II Striping III Mirroring

options.text: I, II
I, II, III
I, III
II, III

question.text: Spreadsheet software is used to predict sales according to the weather. The probability for the weather type (sunny, cloudy, rainy) on the day to be predicted and the predicted sales amount by weather type for each product is entered into the worksheet below. An expression is entered in cell E4 to calculate the predicted sales amount on the day for Product A, and this is copied to cells E5 through E6 and used. Under these conditions, which of the following is an appropriate expression to be entered in cell E4? Here, to obtain the predicted sales amount on the day for each product, the probability for each weather type is multiplied by the predicted sales amount for each of weather type, and then these values are added up.

Which of the following is an OS function that executes multiple application programs concurrently on a single PC, such as when a file is downloaded from a web site while data is processed with spreadsheet software?

options.text: Virtual reality
Dual core
Dual system
Multitasking

question.text: Which of the following is an advantage of using OSS (Open Source Software)?

options.text: Technical support is provided free of charge from the developer at the time of installation.
The software is not prone to infection of viruses, as the source code is not released.
Compensation can be received for damages caused by defects in the software.
The source code can be modified to fit the environment of the user in accordance with the license conditions.

question.text: Multiple files stored on a hard disk are used in work, from Monday to Friday. In order to handle failure of the hard disk, the data is backed up to another hard disk after the end of each day’s work. When the backup has following conditions, what is the total time required (in minutes) to perform backups of data from Monday to Friday? [Conditions: Full backup Friday; Incremental backup Mon-Thu (1,000 modified files/day); 6,000 files total, 3 MB/file; 10 MB/sec speed.]

The tax-inclusive prices of products A and B are calculated by using two (2) tax rates that are set in cells D2 and E2 below. The correct expression that should be entered in cell D4 is $B4*(1.0+D$2), but a wrong expression $B4*(1.0+$D$2) was entered. When the expression that was entered in cell D4 is copied to cells D5, E4, and E5, which of the following is the numeric value that is displayed in cell E5?

When directories d1 and d2 are placed on a web server as shown in the figure, which of the following descriptions specifies the reference of the web page file f2.html on directory d2 from the web page file f1.html on directory d1 (current directory)? [Reference method: .. refers to parent, . refers to current]
question.images: Figure showing directory structure: root/d1/f1.html and root/d2/f2.html

options.text: ../d2/f2.html
./d2/f2.html
/d2/f2.html

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description of a blade server?

options.text: It uses multiple board-type computers equipped with CPU and memory, housed in a dedicated body.
It enables the use of office software, e-mail software, etc. as web services over the Internet.
It is embedded in equipment such as home appliances or automobiles.
It supports handwriting input function by using a liquid crystal display with a touch panel.

question.text: With regard to the colors printed by a printer, theoretically, what color is formed when cyan, magenta, and yellow are mixed together by subtractive color mixing?

options.text: Blue
Red
Black
Green

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description of raster graphics, which is a method of handling the graphics that is used as a collection of points called pixels in painting software?

options.text: It is widely used in CAD.
The color and brightness can be adjusted for each pixel.
The file size is constant regardless of the level of resolution.
No jaggies are visible at the edges of shapes even upon enlargement.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description of a rollback in transaction processing?

options.text: When a transaction attempts to update shared data, it prohibits another transaction from updating that data.
When a transaction has been successfully processed, it commits an update to the database.
When a transaction failed for some reason, it reverts the database to the state before the transaction was started.
It combines multiple tables into one (1) table by using mutually related columns as keys.

question.text: There is the “Employee” table and the “Department” table in a relational database. The “Employee” table and the “Department” table are joined, and employees who live in prefectures different from the prefectures that their departments are located in are extracted. How many employees are extracted?
Which of the following is an appropriate purpose of conducting data normalization when a relational database is constructed?

options.text: Providing redundancy to data in order to detect data errors
Eliminating data inconsistencies and duplications in order to make it easy to maintain and manage the data
Unifying the character code of data in order to improve data reliability and storage efficiency
Losslessly compressing data in order to improve access efficiency

question.text: In a relational database, which of the following is the reason for a primary key being specified?

options.text: To clearly indicate that something is not subject to an arithmetic operation
To enable the search of the column that is specified as the primary key
To prevent another table from referencing the table
To enable any record in the table to be uniquely identified

question.text: Which of the following is a protocol that is used for synchronization of the internal clock of a computer via a network with a server that holds a reference clock?

options.text: FTP
NTP
POP
SMTP

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description of online storage?

options.text: A virtual private network that is established via the Internet
A service that lends disk space for saving data via the Internet
Software that is distributed or sold via the Internet
A computer game that multiple users can simultaneously play via the Internet

question.text: Which of the following mobile communication systems not only offers higher communication speed than LTE, but also allows more devices to connect and has less lag time?

options.text: Block chain
MVNO
8K
5G

question.text: Which of the following is the appropriate combination of terms or phrases to be inserted into blanks A and B in the description below concerning NAT? NAT is often used when an office or a household LAN is connected to the Internet, and it converts between [A] and [B].

options.text: A: private IP addresses B: a MAC address
A: private IP addresses B: a global IP address
A: host names B: a MAC address
A: host names B: a global IP address

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate characteristic of LPWA? (Long Power Wide Area)

options.text: It is a technology concerning AI, and it enables a computer to acquire new knowledge...

It is a wireless network that covers a broad area while consuming only small electrical power, and although its communication speed is lower than a cellphone system, its low electricity consumption enables it to run on common batteries for several years and its broad area coverage enables communication of up to several kilometers.
It is a distributed ledger technology that creates a sequence of data item containing transaction records...
It is an encryption method for wireless LANs, and is recommended for use instead of WEP...

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning biometric authentication?

options.text: If margin for error in matching with the authentication data is made larger, both the possibility of rejecting an authorized person and the possibility of accepting an unauthorized person become smaller.
It eliminates the need to remember IDs and passwords for authentication, and the need to carry keys or cards.
It cannot be used with other authentication methods such as passwords or tokens.
The effective period in which retina pattern and finger vein pattern can be used for authentication is short because they change greatly over years.

question.text: Which of the following is an explanation of spyware?

options.text: It is a scam where money is demanded just by viewing a web site or clicking an image on it.
It is a mechanism where an attacker packages attack tools such as log removal or a back door and hides them in a PC so that the attacker can use them after intrusion.
It is a program that infects a large number of PCs and performs actions such as simultaneous attacks by illegitimately operating the PCs as instructed over a network.
It is a type of malware that illegally obtains personal information or information about PC operations and sends it to an external party.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate disposal method for media that stores confidential information to ensure that information leakage does not occur?

options.text: CDs and DVDs are destroyed and then are disposed of.
A PC is disposed of with its CPU being destroyed.
USB memory is disposed of with its files and folders being deleted.
Paper documentation is not reused as memo paper and is sealed in a confidential envelope and then is disposed of together with general trash.

question.text: Among confidentiality, integrity, and availability, which of the following is the list that contains all and only the properties that are lost in the information security incident below? All of the files on a server in the workplace were encrypted and saved. However, the server was infected by a virus, and a number of the files were deleted. Elimination of the virus and recovery of the files required several hours. During the hours, work could not be performed, and users were inconvenienced. Some files were unable to be recovered.
question.images: Implied description of a ransomware/deletion incident

options.text: Confidentiality
Confidentiality, integrity
Integrity, availability
Availability

question.text: When a user accessed the URL in the body of an e-mail message with a PC, the message shown in the figure appeared on the screen and the PC was locked. Which of the following is used in this attack? (The message implies a demand for payment to unlock the PC).
question.images: Figure/text showing a ransom demand on a locked PC screen

options.text: Keylogger
Spyware
Bot
Ransomware

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate example of activities conducted in A (Act) in the organizations that operate ISMS on the basis of the PDCA model?

options.text: Changing the server monitoring method as a corrective action for the results of the business operations audit
Objectively evaluating the server administrator’s work details by a third party
Identifying the information assets in the server room
Monitoring the operation of the server according to the defined operational procedure

question.text: It is reported that WEP suffers from the problem that ciphers are decoded in a short time. Which of the following is a stronger wireless LAN encryption method?

options.text: ESSID
HTTPS
S/MIME
WPA2

question.text: When a smartphone is used, which of the following is an appropriate preventive measure for shoulder surfing?

options.text: Always using the latest OS
Turning off the GPS function
Affixing a privacy screen protector on the screen
Attaching a strap to prevent fall and theft

question.text: Which of the following is used to confirm that there is no falsification of the content of an e-mail?

options.text: IMAP
SMTP
Information security policy
Digital signature

question.text: Which of the following is not an appropriate security control concerning human resources as a security risk treatment in ISMS?

options.text: Performing background checks and other such checks for all candidates for recruitment in accordance with the relevant laws, regulations, and ethics
Defining official disciplinary proceedings for employees who violate information security, and ensuring employees’ awareness of them
Requesting that all employees at a company comply with information security according to organizational policies and procedures, but not making any request to companies that work is outsourced to

For employees who are leaving a company, defining obligations concerning information security valid after they leave the company, informing the employees about their obligations, and having them fulfill their obligations after they leave

question.text: A document file that is stored on a file server is directly edited on a PC and then an attempt is made to overwrite the file, but the message “You do not have permission, so the file cannot be saved” is displayed. Which of the following is the appropriate combination of permissions that were set for the document file and the folder that it is stored in?
question.images: Implied table of permissions referenced in source

options.text: File read: Yes, File write: Yes, Folder read: No
File read: Yes, File write: No, Folder read: Yes
File read: No, File write: Yes, Folder read: No
File read: No, File write: No, Folder read: Yes

question.text: Mr. A, a developer, is analyzing and verifying the internal structure of a program in order to determine whether input data is processed as intended. Which of the following is the test that Mr. A is currently conducting?

options.text: System test
Top-down test
Black box test
White box test

question.text: Estimation methods for system development include the analogy-based method, the bottom-up method, and the FP (Function Point) method. Which of the following is an appropriate explanation of the FP method?

options.text: It is a method of calculating the required number of person-hours from the volume of the program source code.
It is a method of calculating the required person-hours based on the estimated number of functions implemented.
It is a method of totaling the required person-hours estimated for each activity or task.
It is a method for the estimation of the person-hours for system development that takes into account the differences with similar systems developed in the past.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate test for a user to confirm by himself/herself whether the delivered software satisfies the requirements?

options.text: Acceptance test
Integration test
System test
Unit test

question.text: A company contracted to develop an accounting system and held meetings with the customer to clarify the types of required financial statements and the target processing time from accounting data confirmation to the output of the financial statements. Which of the following is the appropriate process for this activity?

options.text: Requirements definition process
Development process
Planning process
Operation/maintenance process

question.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate explanation of the waterfall model?

options.text: After all activities in each phase in the development are complete, the project proceeds to the next phase.
The functions to be developed are divided, and each function is efficiently and swiftly developed with the use of development tools and parts.
At an early phase in software development, working sample software is created that enables users to visually confirm requirements.
The functions of software are divided, and the software is gradually completed through repeated design and development for each function so that feedback from users can be incorporated.

question.text: Which of the following is the appropriate knowledge area of the project management processes where activities such as determining the roles, responsibilities, and skills required for project team members are classified?

options.text: Project human resource management
Project communication management
Project scope management
Project time management

question.text: In a system development project, the design and development process is to be subcontracted to Company A. In a previous system development, Company A suffered a delay for delivery, so it is also possible that a delay will occur in this project. Which of the following is a response measure that corresponds to mitigation of the risk of a delay?

options.text: The inclusion of causal analysis of the previous delay at Company A, and preventive measures on the basis of this analysis into the development plan
Cancellation of subcontracting to Company A
Inclusion in the contract of the term of the compensation for damages by Company A in the event of a delay
Inclusion in the project of the cost of measures in response to a delay

question.text: There are negative and positive risks in a project. Among the treatment of risks in scheduling, which of the following corresponds to a treatment of a positive risk?

options.text: Having all members receive vaccination before influenza spreads to prevent the members from not being able to work
Reducing the entire project duration by carrying out tasks for creating software programs in parallel when the overall cost can be reduced by advancing the schedule
Securing replacement staff in advance in preparation for delay due to unexpected withdrawal of staff
Purchasing insurance in preparation for payment of a penalty due to delivery delay

question.text: In a development project for a system, there is a plan to create 36 programs with the same size. It was first planned to assign only Mr. A who can create six (6) programs per week, but the plan was changed and it was decided to assign two (2) people: Mr. A, and Mr. B who has half the productivity of Mr. A. When the cost per week for Mr. A and Mr. B is 300 thousand yen and 200 thousand yen respectively, how much is the change in the cost as compared to the original plan?
question.images: Implied calculation for labor cost and productivity

options.text: A decrease of 800 thousand yen
A decrease of 300 thousand yen
An increase of 200 thousand yen
An increase of 1,200 thousand yen

question.text: Activities in project management include project time management, project cost management, and project human resource management, and also include project integration management that coordinates those activities. In a system development project, which of the following is an appropriate action in project integration management in a case where it has been decided that the delivery should be advanced?

options.text: Considering a change in the sequence of tasks in order to shorten the critical path
Comparing and considering a staff increase and the cost for reducing the scheduled duration, as well as the number of days that can be reduced
Estimating the impact on the cost for a case where the scheduled duration is reduced
Reviewing timings when staff members are assigned and revising the staff plan

question.text: When the outsourced development project of a system has passed beyond its halfway mark, there is a request from the outsourcer for adding a function to the system. Which of the following is the most appropriate action of the project manager?

options.text: Accepting the request and securing the budget and staff members
Declining the request by explaining that changes after halfway mark are generally not accepted
Taking into account the impact on the cost and schedule, and following the procedure of change management
Quickly updating the baseline of scope since only the project scope will be affected

question.text: A company orders information system to an overseas vendor under a contract for work. Which of the following is an appropriate activity that is performed as project procurement management by the company?

options.text: At the time of conclusion of the contract, the company agrees upon in writing with the vendor the delivery time for the entire system and the quality standards for its deliverables.
The project manager creates a list of the risks for the project.
At the time of ordering, the company determines the technology to be used for development.
The company collects information from the vendors and receives proposals from them.

question.text: When the operation of an information system is outsourced, which of the following is created in order to agree on the quality level for the service to be provided between the outsourcing party and the contractor?

options.text: ASP
ISP
RFP
SLA

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate measure of facility management that maintains and protects facilities and equipment of information systems?

options.text: Reviewing the fuel replenishment plan in order to maintain the appropriate duration that power can be generated with a private power generation system
Introducing asset management software in order to manage all the company’s software centrally
Standardizing how to set a screen saver in order to prevent unauthorized use of the PCs
Reviewing the network firewall settings in order to enhance the prevention of unauthorized network access to the information systems

question.text: Which of the following is the purpose of incident management?

options.text: Ensuring that activities are performed for migrating new software that is used in an IT service to a production environment
Managing a series of activities for handling a change request about an IT service
Recovering an IT service immediately when any disruption to the IT service occurs, and making the impact to business as small as possible
Managing the information on the items that are required for providing an IT service and on their combinations

question.text: In the PDCA cycle of service level management, which of the following is implemented as C (Check)?

options.text: Providing services on the basis of the SLA
Preparing an improvement plan for services on the basis of the report and review of service provision results
Agreeing upon the desired service quality on the basis of the service requirements and the service improvement plan, and preparing an SLA
Monitoring and measuring the provided services, and preparing a service report

question.text: For a system that accepts a query from a user in the input area on the web site, which of the following is the most appropriate mechanism to efficiently and promptly respond to the query in an interactive and automated manner?

options.text: Recommendation
Chatbot
Escalation
FAQs

question.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate control on the development and implementation of an information systems strategy for improving the competitiveness of a company?

options.text: IT governance
Compliance
Systems audit
Project management

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate explanation of monitoring in internal control?

options.text: It is a process of continuously evaluating if internal control is working effectively.
It is a process of promoting compliance to the laws and other regulations concerning
It is a process for establishing policies and procedures for the appropriate execution of work.
It is a process for responding to the impact of major risks to business operations and systems.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate measure to implement internal controls function?

options.text: Assigning personnel's role so that mutual checks apply to the execution of work.
Avoiding creating a job description indicating the scope of work and roles.
Avoiding creating a work handover document for a successor.
Avoiding separating team members for system development and system operation.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate measure to increase profits for a product without reducing sales volume?

options.text: Reducing the manufacturing cost per unit for a product while maintaining the sales price at a certain level.
Maintaining the manufacturing cost per unit for a product while attempting to reduce the sales price.
Attempting to increase the sales volume of a product while maintaining the sales price at a certain level.
Reducing the sales price of a product while maintaining the sales volume at the current level.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate name for a diagram or a chart that resembles a fishbone and is used for identifying the items that affect the quality?

options.text: Arrow diagram
Cause and effect diagram
Pareto chart
Matrix diagram

question.text: In order to manufacture one (1) unit of a product, 10 kg of the raw material A and 5 kg of the raw material B are needed. If the amount of raw material that can be used in one (1) month is 60 kg of raw material A and 40 kg of raw material B, what is the maximum number of units of the product that can be manufactured in one (1) month?

Retail company A is teaching the general distribution process for food products in an easily understandable manner at elementary schools near the company’s distribution center. Which of the following is an idea behind these activities by company A?

options.text: CSR
Alliance
Core competence
Corporate governance

question.text: The table below is a part of the ingredients table of a steamed meat dumplings lunch box. How many grams of meat is necessary to prepare 100 steamed meat dumplings lunch boxes? (Dumpling stuffing is 20g/unit, Meat is 60g/100g of stuffing, 5 dumplings/lunch box.)

In order to produce one (1) unit of product A, one (1) unit of component B that is procured externally is required. Component B is ordered on the first business day of every month... What is the minimum number of units of component B that must be ordered on the first business day in May?
question.images: Production plan table referenced in source

question.text: Which of the following is an expression that calculates operating profit?

options.text: (Gross profit) − (Selling, general, and administrative expense)
(Sales) − (Cost of sales)
(Current profits) + (Extraordinary profit) − (Extraordinary loss)
(Current net profit before tax) − (Corporate tax, residential tax, and business tax)

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate example of an initiative based on the Green IT concept?

options.text: Use of displays that reduce eye fatigue from blue LED light
Installation of air shower at the server room entrance and exit
Construction of backup systems in preparation for disasters
Setting a policy of viewing materials on PC screens, limiting their printing on paper

question.text: Which of the following is an example of a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)?

options.text: A contract specifying the service content to be provided, which is agreed between the service provider and the customer before the provision of the IT service
A contract specifying that the vendor of computer equipment bears the responsibility of transferring the property right, and that the buyer bears the responsibility of paying the charges.
A contract, specifying the obligation of the outsourcer and outsourcee to maintain confidentiality of the secret information of a party that becomes known to the other party during system development

A contract specifying that an outsourcee to whom the installation of a general-purpose software package has been outsourced performs the task at the outsourcee’s own discretion and responsibility, and receives payment upon the completion of the task

question.text: Which of the following is appropriate as an expected advantage of the adoption of ISO 9001 by companies?

options.text: The companies' trade procedures will be standardized, leading to increased efficiency and the avoidance of non-tariff barriers.
Technical specifications will be standardized in the industry, and increase in product quality and expansion of markets will move forward.
Methods for handling information assets will be standardized and the quality of information security will increase.
Business operations concerning quality management will be standardized, and the quality and efficiency of management will increase.

question.text: Which of the following is an international standard for environmental management systems developed by ISO?

options.text: ISO 9000
ISO/IEC 20000
ISO/IEC 27000

question.text: Which of the following examples of the sending of e-mail is inappropriate from the standpoint of the protection of personal information?
question.images: Implied list of email practices referenced in source

options.text: When sending a mass e-mail to customers, entering all addresses in the “To” (destination) field.
Sending a mass e-mail to customers by entering all addresses in the “BCC” (blind carbon copy) field.
Sending an e-mail with the address of the person in charge as the sender to a person who made an inquiry to the customer center.
When you were arranging a special spring exhibition, you placed the e-mail addresses of selected members in the “BCC” field of an e-mail message and sent the message soliciting exhibits.

question.text: Mr. X stores images taken by a digital camera in a storage medium, inserts the storage medium in a printer, and prints them. It is possible to print the images without taking into consideration the manufacturer of the digital camera. Which of the following is the technical premise concerning image data that enables this?

options.text: Commoditization
Networking
Standardization
Ubiquity

question.text: In Company X, the experience and know-how of employees who have managed drainage treatment in the facility over a long period of time is documented and accumulated, and the accumulated experience and know-how is utilized on daily drainage treatment activities and design of new processing equipment. Which of the following is appropriate as a concept of this example?

options.text: ERP
SFA
Supply chain management
Knowledge management

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate advantage of adopting a method where a single person is in charge of all processes from the start to the completion of manufacturing of a single product?

options.text: The number of products that are in the process of production in the factory decreases.
The entire process is automated.
The necessary number of workers decreases.
The time required for an individual process decreases.

question.text: When Company A considers corporate acquisition (M&A) of Company B, which of the following is the list that contains all and only appropriate disadvantages of the M&A?
question.images: Implied disadvantages (I, II, III) referenced in source

options.text: I, II, III
I
I, III
II

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate explanation of 3C analysis that is used to analyze a business environment?

options.text: The analysis is performed from the three (3) perspectives of the customers, the competitors, and the company.
The analysis is performed from the three (3) perspectives of last purchase date, purchase frequency, and purchase amount.
The analysis is performed by decomposition into the three (3) elements of era, age, and generation.
The analysis is performed by categorization into three (3) groups in descending order of total sales.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning a balanced scorecard (BSC)?

options.text: It is a business management technique that converts a company or organization’s vision and strategy into specific actions from four (4) viewpoints (“financial viewpoint,” “customer viewpoint,” “business process viewpoint,” and “growth and learning viewpoint”).
It is an approach where the corporate activities of providing a product or service to customers are viewed as a chain of activities...
It is an index for measuring the management efficiency of a company in a well-balanced manner from the four (4) viewpoints of solvency, productivity, profitability, and safety.
It is a management technique for improving the profitability of a company by analyzing sales data.

question.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate purpose of improving the efficiency of business processes through outsourcing?

options.text: To increase the investment funds by reducing the operating cost
To focus on core business operations of a company
To develop a next-generation core business that is required in the future
To acquire expertise and knowledge that is lacking from other companies through corporate acquisition, etc.

question.text: Which of the following describes On the Job Training (OJT)?

options.text: It is a method of acquiring skills, knowledge, and know-how from senior employees through actual business operations at the workplace.
It is a method of acquiring skills, knowledge, and know-how through collective training outside of the workplace.
It is a method of acquiring skills, knowledge, and know-how with the use of digital devices and communication networks.
It is a method of acquiring skills, knowledge, and know-how for a career path through self-study.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate case example that corresponds to traceability?

options.text: Taking advantage of the Internet and web technology for the use of computers in education
Outsourcing all development to an external specialized company without placing any development department within one’s own company
Sharing knowledge and information among employees across the entire organization, and utilizing it effectively to improve business performance
Being able to check the history from production up to sales on the basis of the labels pasted on meat and fish products

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate effect of CAD?

options.text: It can identify the required volume of material, and place the optimum order.
It can automate production processes and remove the need for human work.
It can manage the series of production processes in an integrated manner.
It can reuse design data and simplify the streamlining of work.

question.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate example of crowdfunding?

options.text: A company provides a service that enables use of virtual storage on the Internet.
A company collects investments from a large number of persons over the Internet.
A company provides monetary compensation for losses caused by cloudy and rainy weather.
A company develops a technique for discovering desired information from within large volumes of information, with a high degree of accuracy.

question.text: Which of the following corresponds to the lean production system of efficiently manufacturing required products in required quantities by implementing production without waste?

options.text: Flexible manufacturing system
Kanban system
Supply chain management
Material requirements planning

question.text: Which of the following terminologies refers to an initiative to develop unprecedented and innovative services by utilizing IT in the field of finance, such as a service provided by a bank where AI manages depositors’ assets automatically?

options.text: FA
Fintech
OA
Sharing economy

question.text: Which of the following is one of the technologies used in deep learning, and represents a mathematical model of the circuits in the human brain?

options.text: Content delivery network
Storage area network
Neural network
Ubiquitous network

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate effect of CAD?

options.text: It can identify the required volume of material, and place the optimum order.
It can automate production processes and remove the need for human work.
It can manage the series of production processes in an integrated manner.
It can reuse design data and simplify the streamlining of work.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description of “cloud computing”?

options.text: A communication protocol of the Internet
A service model for providing computer resources
A method of software development that can flexibly support changes in the specification
A standard of electronic data exchange that is used in electronic commercial transactions

question.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate term for information in large quantities and in diverse forms that has real-timeness and is expected to help obtain knowledge useful for decision-making?

options.text: Big data
Diversity
Core competence
Crowdfunding

question.text: Attempts are being made to streamline the functions and services of cities and regions and make them more advanced with the use of ICT in order to solve regional problems, and vitalize regions. Which of the following is the most appropriate term to describe such a solution for community development?

options.text: Capacity
Smart city
Diversity
University

question.text: Which of the following is a term for a model where through a service or mechanism matching users and providers, idle assets, such as vehicles, residences, and clothes, that are owned by individuals or companies are lent to others, or services such as providers doing shopping on behalf of another person or giving language lessons in their spare time are provided?

options.text: Cloud computing
Sharing economy
Telework
Work-sharing

question.text: The table below shows the evaluated scores of the proposals of four (4) vendors from the viewpoints of management, technology, and price. When each score... is weighted, and the vendor with the highest total score is selected as the supplier, which of the following vendors is selected? (Weights: Management 2, Technology 3, Price 5)

options.text: Vendor A
Vendor B
Vendor C
Vendor D

question.text: When the system life cycle is divided into the planning process, requirements definition process, development process, and operation/maintenance process, which of the following is the appropriate process to clarify the functions of the system for the implementation of business operations?

options.text: Planning process
Requirements definition process
Development process
Operation/maintenance process

question.text: At power companies, the amount of electricity consumed by each household is measured remotely by communicating with electrical meters that are connected to the Internet... Which of the following is a term that represents the mechanism where a range of devices are connected to the Internet and utilize information in cases such as this?

options.text: EDI
IoT
ISP
RFID

question.text: Which of the following are international development targets that are composed of 17 objectives set by the United Nations in order to achieve a sustainable world?

options.text: COP21
SDGs
